name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

key_work.title: Folioscopes
key_work.brief_description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks.

constellations_primary.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_primary.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

start.title: Toy Story
start.creator_credit: Pixar, Joe Ranft, Bud Luckey, Joel Cohen, Alec Sokolow, Mark Thomas Henne, Bonnie Arnold, Ralph Guggenheim, Andrew Stanton, John Lasseter, Joss Whedon, Pete Docter, Oren Jacob, Darwyn Peachey, Mitch Prater and Brian M. Rosen

video_links.name: Toy Story Trailer 1995 | Disney Throwback | Oh My Disney

start.brief_description: Led by Woody, Andy’s toys live happily in his room until Andy’s birthday brings Buzz Lightyear onto the scene. Afraid of losing his place in Andy’s heart, Woody plots against Buzz. But when circumstances separate Buzz and Woody from their owner, the duo eventually learns to put aside their differences.

constellations_other.name: Unpacking: domestic intimacy and the coming-of-age film
constellations_other.description: Many screen-based narratives focus on packing up and moving house, new starts and teenage bedrooms, or are entirely shot in one room, revealing what we can learn about characters from a domestic environment.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

end.brief_description: An ordinary Lego mini-figure, mistakenly thought to be the extraordinary MasterBuilder, is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil Lego tyrant from gluing the universe together.

links.description: Famously Toy Story’s Pizza Planet truck has appeared in every Pixar film to date except The Incredibles, however it does make a cameo in The Incredibles videogame and appears also in The Lego Movie videogame.

end.title: Peter Rabbit
end.creator_credit: Sony Pictures Animation, Will Gluck, Zareh Nalbandian, Rob Lieber and Michael Furniss
end.headline_credit: Australia, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
end.brief_description: Peter Rabbit’s feud with Mr. McGregor escalates to greater heights than ever before as they rival for the affections of the warm-hearted animal lover who lives next door.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

links.description: The Lego Movie’s VFX company Animal Logic also oversaw the visual effects and animation on Peter Rabbit. The film features both live action and animated characters and stars several Australian actors including Rose Byrne, Margot Robbie and Sia.

end.title: Animal Logic and Peter Rabbit
end.credit_line:
PETER RABBIT and all associated characters ™ & © Frederick Warne & Co Limited. PETER RABBIT™, the Movie ©2018 Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
PETER RABBIT and all associated characters ™ & © Frederick Warne & Co Limited. PETER RABBIT™ 2:The Runaway, the Movie ©2020 Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
Special thanks to Columbia Pictures
end.brief_description: Bringing the beloved characters of Beatrix Potter to life is no easy task, but Australian VFX studio Animal Logic did exactly that in Peter Rabbit and its sequel Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

links.description: You can find out more about Animal Logic by visiting artist and costume designer Edie Kurzer’s display in the Federation Square foyer.

start.title: Meet the Robinsons
start.creator_credit: Dorothy McKim, Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Stephen J. Anderson, Michelle Bochner Spitz and Aurian Redson
start.brief_description: In this animated adventure, brilliant preteen inventor Lewis creates a memory scanner to retrieve his earliest recollections and find out why his mother gave him up for adoption.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

Afraid of losing his place in Andy’s heart, Woody plots against Buzz. But when circumstances separate Buzz and Woody from their owner, the duo eventually learns to put aside their differences.

constellations_other.description: Many screen-based narratives focus on packing up and moving house, new starts and teenage bedrooms, or are entirely shot in one room, revealing what we can learn about characters from a domestic environment.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

links.description: Toy Story was the first film to fully use 3D computer animation with the new software developed for filming lending itself to geometric objects, like blocks and balls, the very things found in Andy’s toybox.

end.title: Johnson & Friends
end.creator_credit: John D. Patterson and Ian Munro
end.brief_description: Johnson and Friends is one of the most beloved Australian kids shows, airing on the ABC in the perfect timeslot between school and dinner. It featured toys that came to life and starred ACMI CEO Katrina Sedgwick as McDuff.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

recommendations.quote: Before Katrina Sedgwick landed the lead role at ACMI, she starred in a range of iconic TV shows and movies, including The Last Wave (1977) and E Street (1989). But our favourite role of Katrina's is the cheeky concertina McDuff in Johnson and Friends (1990–95).

links.description: Johnson and his friends are another group of toys that come to life when their owner Michael leaves the room. The live action TV show explores the lives of the toys while also delivering an educational message for its young viewers.

end.title: My Little Pony: The Movie
end.creator_credit: Marcia Gwendolyn Jones, Brian Goldner, Stephen Davis, Haven Alexander, Lionsgate, DHX Media, Hasbro Studios, Allspark Pictures, Rita Hsiao, Joe Ballarini, Meghan McCarthy, Jayson Thiessen and Michael Vogel
end.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2017

video_links.name: My Little Pony: The Movie (2017) Official Trailer – Emily Blunt, Sia, Zoe Saldana – In Theaters 10/6

end.brief_description: A new dark force threatens Ponyville, and the Mane 6 – Twilight Sparkle, Applejack, Rainbow Dash, Pinkie Pie, Fluttershy and Rarity – embark on an unforgettable journey beyond Equestria where they meet new friends and exciting challenges on a quest to use the magic of friendship and save their home.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

links.description: Sia also starred as Songbird Serenade in My Little Pony: The Movie with her character’s animated design reflecting Sia’s real life onstage persona, complete with large black and white wigs.

start.title: Folioscopes
start.brief_description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks.

end.brief_description: In this animated adventure, brilliant preteen inventor Lewis creates a memory scanner to retrieve his earliest recollections and find out why his mother gave him up for adoption.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

links.description: Walt Disney Animation Studios have used their Steamboat Willie flipbook for their animated logo since 2007. 3D computer animated film, Meet the Robinsons was the first to show this new logo.
